definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The fingerprints found on the gun were used to convict her.
sentences.chinese: 槍上發現的指紋被用來判明她有罪。

sentences.english: He pauses a moment at the foot of a tree to take his bearings.
sentences.chinese: 他在一棵樹下面停了下來，以便判明自己的方位。

sentences.english: Ascertaining case quality is an important job of criminal investigation.
sentences.chinese: 判明案件性質是刑事偵查的一項重要任務。

sentences.english: Figure out kitty’s mood by paying attention to the speed and volume of his mewling.
sentences.chinese: 要關注貓叫聲的大小和速率來判明貓的心情。

sentences.english: The Constable was justified in shooting an escaped criminal in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 警察出於自衛而槍擊逃犯的行爲被判明無罪。

definition: to infer/to consider and come to a judgment/to recommend/to estimate/deduced to be
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
